summary: Responsive, clean, professional frontend website for a college mini project titled “Online Food Ordering System,” representing a food ordering platform with Customer, Restaurant, and Delivery Partner portals, plus About, Technologies Used, and Footer sections (UI-only; backend conceptual).
architectural_notes: Frontend-only implementation (UI only for login/registration). Backend/database are conceptual (e.g., Firebase) for academic demonstration.
Site should be responsive with a clean, simple, professional presentation suitable for a college mini project.
Add clickable dish images in the Customer Portal menu; clicking opens a modal popup with a larger image (can use placeholder/sample images).
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Square top-down photo-style image of a Margherita pizza on a plate with neutral background (dish-pizza.dim_512x512.png)
- Square photo-style image of a classic burger with fries on a neutral background (dish-burger.dim_512x512.png)
- Square photo-style image of chicken biryani in a bowl with neutral background (dish-biryani.dim_512x512.png)
- Square photo-style image of pasta in a bowl with neutral background (dish-pasta.dim_512x512.png)
- Square photo-style image of a sandwich on a plate with neutral background (dish-sandwich.dim_512x512.png)
- Square photo-style image of noodles in a bowl with neutral background (dish-noodles.dim_512x512.png)

existing_features.title: Create a responsive Home page for the website titled “Online Food Ordering System” that includes: (1) the main title “Online Food Ordering System”, (2) subtitle “Order your favorite food anytime, anywhere”, (3) a short description explaining the platform connects customers, restaurants, and delivery partners, and (4) three prominent CTA buttons linking/navigating to: Customer Portal, Restaurant Portal, and Delivery Partner Portal.

Implement a Customer Portal section/page containing: (1) Customer Login / Registration UI (UI only; no real authentication), (2) a Restaurant Listing with sample restaurants, (3) a Food Menu with sample items and prices: Pizza – ₹199, Burger – ₹129, Biryani – ₹249, each with an “Order Now” button, (4) an Order Form with fields Name, Phone Number, Food Item, Quantity, Delivery Address, and (5) an Order Status tracker showing the states: Received → Preparing → Out for Delivery → Delivered.

Implement a Restaurant Portal section/page containing: (1) Restaurant Login UI (UI only; no real authentication), (2) a dashboard area that shows “New Orders” and “Accepted Orders”, (3) a sample order list showing order ID, food item, and status, (4) “Accept Order” and “Reject Order” buttons for sample orders, and (5) a Menu Management section listing food items and prices.

Implement a Delivery Partner Portal section/page containing: (1) Delivery Partner Login UI (UI only; no real authentication), (2) an Assigned Orders section listing sample assigned orders with Order ID, Pickup Restaurant, and Delivery Address, and (3) “Picked Up” and “Delivered” buttons for assigned orders.

Add an “About Project” section/page with the exact concept described: it is a frontend implementation developed using a no-code website builder, demonstrating workflow between customers, restaurants, and delivery partners, and that backend/database operations are explained conceptually.
Add a “Technologies Used” section/page that lists exactly: Frontend: No-code website builder; Backend: Conceptual (Firebase); Database: Conceptual.
Add a Footer to the site that includes: “College Mini Project”, “Online Food Ordering System”, and “Thank You”.

Apply a consistent, clean, simple, professional visual theme suitable for academic presentation across all pages/sections, including typography, spacing, and a cohesive color palette (avoid blue/purple). Ensure mobile-first responsiveness for key layouts (home CTAs, portal dashboards/lists, and forms).
Add real dish images (static assets) for each sample menu item in the Customer Portal menu (Pizza, Burger, Biryani, Pasta, Sandwich, Noodles), replacing the current emoji-only presentation.

Make each dish image in the Customer Portal menu clickable so that clicking the image opens a modal/popup showing a larger version of that dish image (option 1). The modal must be dismissible and must not break the existing "Order Now" button behavior.

Update the Customer Portal menu data model in frontend/src/pages/CustomerPortal.tsx so each menu item references its corresponding static image filename, and wire the UI to use those image files with appropriate alt text in English.

Build Customer Portal UI: login/registration, restaurant listing, sample menu items with prices, Order Now buttons, order form, and order status tracker
Build Restaurant Portal UI: login, dashboard (new/accepted orders), sample order list (ID/item/status), accept/reject buttons, and menu management list
Build Delivery Partner Portal UI: login, assigned orders list (order ID, pickup restaurant, delivery address) with Picked Up/Delivered buttons
Add About Project section describing frontend no-code implementation and conceptual backend/database workflow
Add Technologies Used section: Frontend (no-code website builder), Backend (conceptual Firebase), Database (conceptual)
Add Footer with: College Mini Project, Online Food Ordering System, Thank You
Add dish images to menu items and make them clickable to open a larger image popup/modal (option 1)
